member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.DeviceEnumerator
member.summary: An enumerator for all of the available input devices including 2D input devices (e.g., keyboard, mouse) and 6DOF input devices (e.g., InterSense tracker).
member.remarks: It's possible to access each device class directly, but this class provides simple APIs to access the available devices

member.summary: Creates a device enumerator and enumerates all of the available input devices
member.remarks: This constructor calls Reenumerate method, so you don't need to call it in your code for initial enumeration.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.DeviceEnumerator.Reenumerate
member.summary: Reenumerates all of the available input devices.
member.remarks: The constructor calls this method, so you should only call this method if you plugged/unplugged any input devices after calling the constructor

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.Generic.KeyboardInput
member.summary: A helper class for handling the keyboard input. This class wraps the functionalities provided by XNA's KeyboardState class. Keyboard events are handled based on interrupt method (callback functions), rather than the polling method (XNA's KeyboardState), so that the developer doesn't need to poll the status of the keyboard state every frame by herself/himself.
member.remarks: KeyboardInput is a singleton class, so you should access this class through Instance property.

member.summary: Keyboard state, set every frame in the Update method.

member.summary: A helper class for handling the mouse input. member.remarks: MouseInput is a singleton class, so you should access this class through Instance property.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.DESPredictor.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a double-exponential-smoothing predictor with the specified alpha values, delta time increment, and thresholds.
member.param: An alpha value used for translational smoothing.
An alpha value used for rotational smoothing.
The time delta between each prediction time

A translational threshold. If set to larger than 0, then if the distance between the previous transformation and the current transformation is larger than this threshold, then the current transformation will be dropped from the smoothing calculation.

A rotational threshold. If set to largen than 0, then if the angle (in radians) between the previous transformation and the current transformation is larger than this threshold, then the current transformation will be dropped from the smoothing calculation.

An alpha value used for rotational smoothing.
The time delta between each prediction time.

member.summary: Creates a double-exponential-smoothing predictor with the specified alpha value, and delta time increment with no thresholds.
member.param: An alpha value used for both translational and rotational smoothing.
The time delta between each prediction time.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.DESSmoother
member.summary: A helper class for smoothing out the incoming matrix values based on double exponential smoothing (DES) algorithm (The equations can be found at http://www.itl.nist.gov/div898/handbook/pmc/section4/pmc433.htm). We use 'b1 = y2 - y1' equation to set the initial value of b1.

The original rotation
A smoothed/filterd matrix

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Device.Util.DESSmoother.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Creates a DES smoother with alpha and gamma values ([0.0f - 1.0f] excluding 0) without translation or rotational threhold. Both translation and rotation alpha and gamma values will be set to 'alpha' and 'gamma' respectively.
member.param: The alpha value used in the first equation (see the website mentioned in the summary of this class). The larger the alpha value, the heavier the weight of the incoming matrix. If alpha is 0.3f, then the smoothed matrix will be roughly incoming * 0.3f + previous * 0.7f.
The gamma value used in the second equation.
member.exception: If alpha or gamma values are outside of the range

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.DebugShapeRenderer
member.summary: A system for handling rendering of various debug shapes.
member.remarks:
The DebugShapeRenderer allows for rendering line-base shapes in a batched fashion. Games will call one of the many Add* methods to add a shape to the renderer and then a call to Draw will cause all shapes to be rendered. This mechanism was chosen because it allows game code to call the Add* methods wherever is most convenient, rather than having to add draw methods to all of the necessary objects.
Additionally the renderer supports a lifetime for all shapes added. This allows for things like visualization of raycast bullets. The game would call the AddLine overload with the lifetime parameter and pass in a positive value. The renderer will then draw that shape for the given amount of time without any more calls to AddLine being required.
The renderer's batching mechanism uses a cache system to avoid garbage and also draws as many lines in one call to DrawUserPrimitives as possible. If the renderer is trying to draw more lines than are allowed in the Reach profile, it will break them up into multiple draw calls to make sure the game continues to work for any game.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Geometry.PartialDisk
member.summary: A partial disk geometry primitive constructed with CustomMesh

members.member:
Creates a partial disk on the Y = 0 plane. A partial disk is similar to a full disk, except that only the subset of the disk from start through start + sweep is included (where 0 degrees is along the +Y axis, 90 degrees along the +X axis)
Specifies the inner radius of the partial disk (can be 0). Specifies the outer radius of the partial disk. Must be greater than the 'inner' radius. Specifies the number of subdivisions around the Z axis. Must be greater than 2. Specifies the starting angle, in radians, of the disk portion. Specifies the sweep angle, in radians, of the disk portion. /// Specifies whether to render both front and back side

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightType.Point
member.summary: A point source is defined as a single point in space. The intensity of the light is attenuated with three attenuation coefficients.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightType.Directional
member.summary: A directional source is described by the direction in which it is pointing, and is useful for modeling a light source that is effectively infinitely far away from the objects it illuminates.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightType.SpotLight
member.summary: A spotlight is useful for creating dramatic localized lighting effects. It is defined by its position, the direction in which it is pointing, and the width of the beam of light it produces.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource
member.summary: Light sources are used to illuminate the world.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.#ctor

member.summary: Copy constructor

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of this light (Point, Directional, or SpotLight) The default value is LightType.Directional.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this light source is enabled. The default value is true.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Diffuse
member.summary: Gets or sets the diffuse component of this light. The default value is Color.Black.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Specular
member.summary: Gets or sets the specular component of this light. The default value is Color.Black.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of this light source. This property is used only for Point and SpotLight types. The default value is vector (0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.TransformedPosition
member.summary: Gets the transformed version of the Position property by the associated LightNode's WorldTransformation.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of this light source. This property is used only for Directional and SpotLight types. The default value is vector (0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.TransformedDirection
member.summary: Gets the transformed version of the Direction property by the associated LightNode's WorldTransformation.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Attenuation0
member.summary: Gets or sets the zero-th degree attenuation coefficient for estimating light energy attenuation. This property is used only for Point and SpotLight types. The default value is 0.01f.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Attenuation1
member.summary: Gets or sets the first degree attenuation coefficient for estimating light energy attenuation. This property is used only for Point and SpotLight types. The default value is 0.1f.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Attenuation2
member.summary: Gets or sets the second degree attenuation coefficient for estimating light energy attenuation. This property is used only for Point and SpotLight types. The default value is 0.0f.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.InnerConeAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the inner radius of the spotlight where the light begins to be attenuated. This property is used only for SpotLight type. The default value is 0.2f * PI (36 degrees).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.OuterConeAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the outer radius of the spotlight where the light intensity (ambient) is zero. The default value is 0.3f * PI (54 degrees).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.LightSource.Range
member.summary: Gets or sets the effective range of this light source. This property is used only for Point and SpotLight types. The default value is 500.

member.summary: Gets the offset transformation from the origin of the world coordinate.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.Model.OffsetToOrigin
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to relocate the model to the origin. The default value is false.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ExplosionParticleEffect
member.summary: ExplosionParticleSystem is a specialization of ParticleSystem which creates a fiery explosion. It should be combined with ExplosionSmokeParticleSystem for best effect.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect
member.summary: ParticleSystem is an abstract class that provides the basic functionality to create a particle effect. Different subclasses will have different effects, such as fire, explosions, and plumes of smoke. To use these subclasses, simply call AddParticles, and pass in where the particles should exist

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.minNumParticles
member.summary: minNumParticles and maxNumParticles control the number of particles that are added when AddParticles is called. The number of particles will be a random number between minNumParticles and maxNumParticles.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.textureFilename
member.summary: this controls the texture that the particle system uses. It will be used as an argument to ContentManager.Load.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.minInitialSpeed
member.summary: minInitialSpeed and maxInitialSpeed are used to control the initial velocity of the particles. The particle's initial speed will be a random number between these two. The direction is determined by the function PickRandomDirection, which can be overriden.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.minAcceleration
member.summary: minAcceleration and maxAcceleration are used to control the acceleration of the particles. The particle's acceleration will be a random number between these two. By default, the direction of acceleration is the same as the direction of the initial velocity.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.minRotationSpeed
member.summary: minRotationSpeed and maxRotationSpeed control the particles' angular velocity: the speed at which particles will rotate. Each particle's rotation speed will be a random number between minRotationSpeed and maxRotationSpeed. Use smaller numbers to make particle systems look calm and wispy, and large numbers for more violent effects.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.minLifetime
member.summary: minLifetime and maxLifetime are used to control the lifetime. Each particle's lifetime will be a random number between these two. Lifetime is used to determine how long a particle "lasts." Also, in the base implementation of Draw, lifetime is also used to calculate alpha and scale values to avoid particles suddenly "popping" into view

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.minScale
member.summary: to get some additional variance in the appearance of the particles, we give them all random scales. the scale is a value between minScale and maxScale, and is additionally affected by the particle's lifetime to avoid particles "popping" into view.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.blendState
member.summary: different effects can use different blend states. fire and explosions work well with additive blending, for example.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a new ParticleSystem.
member.param: the maximum number of particle effects that are expected on screen at once.
a sprite batch instance used to draw the particles

whether to compute the particle positions in 3D space, and project to the screen space at the time of drawing. Setting this to true can be expensive if you add many particles, but if you want to make the particles appear at appropriate locations in AR space, it is necessary to set this to true
member.remarks: it is tempting to set the value of howManyEffects very high. However, this value should be set to the minimum possible, because it has a large impact on the amount of memory required, and slows down the Update and Draw functions.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.Initialize
member.summary:
override the base class's Initialize to do some additional work; we want to call InitializeConstants to let subclasses set the constants that we'll use.
also, the particle array and freeParticles queue are set up here.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.InitializeConstants
member.summary: this abstract function must be overriden by subclasses of ParticleSystem. It's here that they should set all the constants marked in the region "constants to be set by subclasses", which give each ParticleSystem its specific flavor.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.LoadContent
member.summary: Override the base class LoadContent to load the texture. once it's loaded, calculate the origin.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.AddParticles(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: AddParticles's job is to add an effect somewhere on the screen. If there aren't enough particles in the freeParticles queue, it will use as many as it can. This means that if there not enough particles available, calling AddParticles will have no effect.
member.param: where the particle effect should be created

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.AddParticles3D(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: AddParticles3D's job is to add an effect somewhere on the screen. If there aren't enough particles in the freeParticles queue, it will use as many as it can. This means that if there not enough particles available, calling AddParticles3D will have no effect.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.InitializeParticle(GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.Particle,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector2)
member.summary: InitializeParticle randomizes some properties for a particle, then calls initialize on it. It can be overriden by subclasses if they want to modify the way particles are created. For example, SmokePlumeParticleSystem overrides this function make all particles accelerate to the right, simulating wind.
member.param: the particle to initialize
the position on the screen that the particle should be

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.InitializeParticle3D(GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.Particle,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Vector3)
member.summary: InitializeParticle3D randomizes some properties for a particle, then calls initialize on it. It can be overriden by subclasses if they want to modify the way particles are created. For example, SmokePlumeParticleSystem overrides this function make all particles accelerate to the right, simulating wind.
member.param: the particle to initialize
the position on the screen that the particle should be

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.PickRandomDirection
member.summary: PickRandomDirection is used by InitializeParticles to decide which direction particles will move. The default implementation is a random vector in a circular pattern.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.PickRandomDirection3D
member.summary: PickRandomDirection3D is used by InitializeParticles3D to decide which direction particles will move. The default implementation is a random vector in a circular pattern.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.Update(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: overriden from DrawableGameComponent, Update will update all of the active particles.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.Render(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary: Draw will use ParticleSampleGame's sprite batch to render all of the active particles.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.FreeParticleCount
member.summary: returns the number of particles that are available for a new effect.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MinNumParticles
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum number of particles that are added when AddParticles is called. The number of particles will be a random number between MinNumParticles and MaxNumParticles.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MaxNumParticles
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of particles that are added when AddParticles is called. The number of particles will be a random number between MinNumParticles and MaxNumParticles.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.TextureFilename
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture that the particle system uses.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MinInitialSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum initial speed used to control the initial velocity of the particles. he particle's initial speed will be a random number between MinInitialSpeed and MaxInitialSpeed. The direction is determined by the function PickRandomDirection, which can be overriden.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MaxInitialSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum initial speed used to control the initial velocity of the particles. he particle's initial speed will be a random number between MinInitialSpeed and MaxInitialSpeed. The direction is determined by the function PickRandomDirection, which can be overriden.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MinAcceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum acceleration used to control the acceleration of the particles. The particle's acceleration will be a random number between MinAcceleration and MaxAcceleration. By default, the direction of acceleration is the same as the direction of the initial velocity.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MaxAcceleration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum acceleration used to control the acceleration of the particles. The particle's acceleration will be a random number between MinAcceleration and MaxAcceleration. By default, the direction of acceleration is the same as the direction of the initial velocity.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MinRotationSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum rotation speed that controls the particles' angular velocity: the speed at which particles will rotate. Each particle's rotation speed will be a random number between MinRotationSpeed and MaxRotationSpeed. Use smaller numbers to make particle systems look calm and wispy, and large numbers for more violent effects.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MaxRotationSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum rotation speed that controls the particles' angular velocity: the speed at which particles will rotate. Each particle's rotation speed will be a random number between MinRotationSpeed and MaxRotationSpeed. Use smaller numbers to make particle systems look calm and wispy, and large numbers for more violent effects.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MinLifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum lifetime used to control the lifetime. Each particle's lifetime will be a random number between MinLifetime and MaxLifetime. Lifetime is used to determine how long a particle "lasts." Also, in the base implementation of Draw, lifetime is also used to calculate alpha and scale values to avoid particles suddenly "popping" into view

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MaxLifetime
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum lifetime used to control the lifetime. Each particle's lifetime will be a random number between MinLifetime and MaxLifetime. Lifetime is used to determine how long a particle "lasts." Also, in the base implementation of Draw, lifetime is also used to calculate alpha and scale values to avoid particles suddenly "popping" into view

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MinScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum scale. To get some additional variance in the appearance of the particles, we give them all random scales. the scale is a value between MinScale and MaxScale, and is additionally affected by the particle's lifetime to avoid particles "popping" into view.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.MaxScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum scale. To get some additional variance in the appearance of the particles, we give them all random scales. the scale is a value between MinScale and MaxScale, and is additionally affected by the particle's lifetime to avoid particles "popping" into view.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.ParticleEffect.ComputeIn3D
member.summary: Gets whether to compute the particle positions in 3D space, and project to the screen space at the time of drawing. Setting this to true can be expensive if you add many particles, but if you want to make the particles appear at appropriate locations in AR space, it is necessary to set this to true. Default value is false.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.Particle
member.summary: particles are the little bits that will make up an effect. each effect will be comprised of many of these particles. They have basic physical properties, such as position, velocity, acceleration, and rotation. They'll be drawn as sprites, all layered on top of one another, and will be very pretty.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Graphics.ParticleEffects2D.SmokePlumeParticleEffect
member.summary: SmokePlumeParticleSystem is a specialization of ParticleSystem which sends up a plume of smoke. The smoke is blown to the right by the wind.

member.summary: PickRandomDirection is overriden so that we can make the particles always move have an initial velocity pointing up.
member.returns: a random direction which points basically up.

member.name: E:GoblinXNA.Helpers.Interpolator.DoneEvent
member.summary: An event to be called when the interpolation is done.
member.remarks: You need to keep accessing the Value property in order to have this event triggered when the interpolation finishes. If Value property is not accessed, then this event will never be triggered. This is not a timer class, so do not use this as a timer.

member.exception: If you try to set this value after the interpolation starts and before the interpolation finishes

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Helpers.Interpolator.Done

member.summary: Log will create automatically a log file and write log/warning/error info for simple runtime error checking, which is very useful for minor errors. The application can still continue working, but this log provides an easy way to find errors. Also, you can enable WriteToNotifier to make the log message appear on the screen if State.ShowNotification is enabled.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Helpers.MatrixHelper.HasMovedSignificantly(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary: Checks whether a transformation has changed/moved significantly compared to the previous transformation with 0.01f translational threshold and 0.1f * Math.PI / 180 rotational threshold. This means that if either the transformation's translation component changed more than 0.1f in distance or rotation component changed more than 0.1f * Math.PI / 180 radians in any of the three (x, y, z) directions, then it's judged as having moved significantly.
member.param: The previous transformation matrix
The current transformation matrix

The rotational threshold

member.summary: Unproject method that is 30 times faster than the Viewport.Unproject function due to the usage of pre-computed values. Make sure to call PrepareUnproject method for the pre-computation to happen, and then call this Unproject method unless any of the variables passed in to PrepareUnproject changes (if they do change, make sure to call it again with update values to guarantee correct unprojection).

member.summary: This is the delegate of the tweening functions. All functions must calculate the current position of the tweener based on how long has elapsed, where to start, the total amount to move and the total duration. See the library classes for several useful tweening functions.
member.param: The time that has elapsed since the beginning of the tweener.
Where did the tweener start
How much will the tweener move from start to end
The total duration of tweening.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Helpers.XNATweener.BaseTweener`1
member.summary:
The BaseTweener class handles moving a Position from start to end in the specified time using a specific function. Whenever the Tweener is updated, which is done by a call to Update, it will move the Position further along the path to completion. On each update an updated event is called so you can respond to the Position change. When the Tweener has reached the end it will stop and signal that is it finished using the Ended event. It is possible to stop the Tweener, pausing it until it is started again. You can also reset the Tweener to repeat the same movement, reset it with new parameters or even reverse the direction of the tweener.
Note that this is an abstract class, refer to the concrete subclasses for tweening the value you want tweened.

The position reached at the end
How long befor we reach the end?
Which function to use for calculating the current position.

The tweener can be started again by calling Play
Reset the tweener to start again from the beginning.
If the tweener is stopped it will not start, use Restart if that is what you want.

A helper class for checking performance of certain code blocks.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.IPhysicsObject.CenterOfMass
member.summary: Gers or sets the relative position of the default center of mass, which is at (0, 0, 0).
member.remarks: This value can be used to set the relative offset of the center of mass of a rigid body. When a rigid body is created the center of mass is set the the point (0, 0, 0), and normally this is the best setting for a rigid body. However the are situations in which and object does not have symmetry or simple some kind of special effect is desired, and this origin need to be changed.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Physics.Matali.MataliPhysics.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a physics engine that uses Matali Physics from Komires.
member.remarks:
For all of the shapes that has directions (e.g., Cylinder, Hemisphere), Y direction is used, so if you would like it to face other directions, use MataliObject.ShapeOriginalMatrix to orient them.
For a cylinder with different bottom and top radius, IPhysicsObject.ShapeData are used. ShapeData[0] - bottom radius, ShapeData[1] - height, ShapeData[2] = top radius
For Compound shape, an additional information can be set by using MataliObject.CompoundShape.
For additional shape types such as Heightmap, Point, and so on, set Shape to ShapeType.Extra and define MataliObject.ExtraShape.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Physics.Matali.MataliPhysics.GetMataliPhysicsObject(GoblinXNA.Physics.IPhysicsObject)
member.summary: Gets the associated Matali's PhysicsObject instance from a physics object.

member.summary: Creates a constraint between two existing physical objects.
member.remarks: The constraints are not actually added at this stage, but in the Update method.

The far point of the pick ray

member.summary: Modifies an existing height map field with short arrays.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Physics.Matali.MataliPhysics.AddConstraint
member.summary: Actually adds the constraints to the physics engine.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Physics.Matali.MataliPhysics.SetShape(Komires.MataliPhysics.PhysicsObject,GoblinXNA.Physics.IPhysicsObject)
member.remarks:
For all of the shapes that has directions (e.g., Cylinder, Hemisphere), Y direction is used, so if you would like it to face other directions, use MataliObject.ShapeOriginalMatrix to orient them.
For a cylinder with different bottom and top radius, IPhysicsObject.ShapeData are used. ShapeData[0] - bottom radius, ShapeData[1] - height, ShapeData[2] = top radius
For Compound shape, an additional information can be set by using MataliObject.CompoundShape.
For additional shape types such as Heightmap, Point, and so on, set Shape to ShapeType.Extra and define MataliObject.ExtraShape.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Matali.MataliPhysics.Gravity
member.summary: Default is 9.81f.

member.summary: Default is 10.

member.summary: Default is 1/15 (15 Hz)

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.Matali.MataliPhysics.BuildCollisionMesh
member.summary: MataliPhysics builds collision mesh for only Shapes that requires a call to CreateMesh() method including TriangleMesh, Heightmap, CompoundShape, etc. Set this to true if you want MataliPhysics to build collision mesh for any shape types when you want to visualize the collision mesh for debugging purposes (not recommended to be set to true unless you really need them)

member.summary: Add doors that can fling. If you don't need certain doors, just pass null (e.g., if your car only has front doors, then pass rearLeftDoor and rearRightDoor as null).

member.summary: Add doors that are made of a composite object and can fling. If you don't need certain doors, just pass null (e.g., if your car only has front doors, then pass rearLeftDoorComposite and rearRightDoorComposite as null).
member.remarks: Doors are optional.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.Physics.PickedObject.IntersectParam
member.summary: Gets the intersection parameter with value ranging from 0.0f (near point) to 1.0f (far point).
member.remarks: For example, 0.5f means the intersection point was right in the middle of near point and far point cast ray. To get the picked point, you can simply do pickedPoint = (nearPoint + (farPoint - nearPoint) * intersectParam)

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera
member.summary: Camera represents a view frustum (camera) in the 3D space. It describes how the viewed 3D space is transformed to a 2D surface (render window).

member.summary: Creates a camera with vertical field of view of 45 degrees, 1.0f near clipping plane and 1000f far clipping plane.

member.summary: Copy constructor.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.Translation
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of this camera's view point. The default value is (0, 0, 0).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of this camera's view point. The initial forward vector is (0, 0, -1) (into the display), and the up vector is (0, 1, 0).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.View
member.summary: Gets or sets the view transform.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.CameraTransformation
member.summary: Gets the transformation created by composing Rotation and Translation.
member.remarks: = Matrix.CreateFromQuaternion(rotation) * Matrix.CreateTranslation(translation)

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.Projection
member.summary: Gets or sets the projection matrix of this camera. If this matrix is not set, then the project matrix is calculated by using the FieldOfViewY, AspectRatio, ZNearPlane, and ZFarPlane. If this matrix is set to a matrix, then that matrix will be returned when accessing this value.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.FieldOfViewY
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical field of view in radians. The default value is MathHelper.ToRadians(45)

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.AspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the aspect ratio. Default value is set to Viewport.Width / Viewport.Height

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.ZNearPlane
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance of the near clipping plane from the view position. The default value is 1.0f.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Camera.ZFarPlane
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance of the far clipping plane from the view position. The default value is 1000.0f;

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.GeometryNode.AlwaysRender

member.remarks: This property is ignored if Scene.EnableFrustumCulling is set to false.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LightNode.Global
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this light is a global light source. If set to true, then no matter where in the scene graph this light node exists, the light source associated with this node will affect all objects in the scene graph. If set to false, then this node's light source will affect only this node's siblings and siblings children. The default value is true.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LightNode.CastShadows
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this light should cast shadows when Scene.EnableShadowMapping is set to true. The default value is true. You should also set LightProjection property if you set this to true.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LightNode.HasChanged
member.summary: Indicates whether the light source or light node itself has changes to be reflected.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to automatically compute the appropriate level of details to use based on the distances set in AutoComputeDistances.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.LODNode.AutoComputeDistances
member.summary: Gets or sets the distances to use to switch among different level of details automatically when AutoComputeLevelOfDetail is set to true. The number of distances should be (Models.Count - 1).
member.exception: If number of distances is incorrect

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerBundleNode
member.summary:
A scene graph node that defines a bundle of optically tracked fiducial marker arrays. The supporting marker nodes can supplement the tracking of the base marker array if the base marker array is not visible.
Any nodes added below a MarkerBundleNode with WorldTranformation properties will be affected by the transformation returned by the marker tracker including GeometryNode, ParticleNode, SoundNode, CameraNode, and LightNode.
member.remarks: Do not add any of the supporting marker nodes to the scene since they will be updated automatically by this node.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode
member.summary:
A scene graph node that defines an optically tracked fiducial marker.
Any nodes added below a MarkerNode with WorldTranformation properties will be affected by the transformation returned by the marker tracker including GeometryNode, ParticleNode, SoundNode, CameraNode, and LightNode.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.#ctor(System.String,GoblinXNA.Device.Vision.Marker.IMarkerTracker,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a node that is tracked by fiducial marker (can be either an array or a single marker) and updated automatically.
member.param: Name of this marker node
A marker tracker used to track this fiducial marker
A list of configs that specify the fiducial marker (can be either an array or a single marker) to look for

member.summary: Creates a node that is tracked by fiducial marker (can be either an array or a single marker) and updated automatically.
member.param: A marker tracker used to track this fiducial marker
A list of configs that specify the fiducial marker (can be either an array or a single marker) to look for

member.summary: Marker node does not allow cloning a node.
member.exception: If this method is called

member.summary: Updates the current matrix of this marker node
member.param: Elapsed time from last update in milliseconds

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.MarkerID
member.summary: Gets the marker ID returned by the marker tracker library.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.Smoother
member.summary: Gets or sets the smoother used to filter the matrix returned by the optical marker tracker.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.Predictor
member.summary: Gets or sets the prediction filter to apply to the transformation returned by the optical marker tracker.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.MaxDropouts
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of dropouts. If it fails to detect the marker within 'MaxDropouts' frames, the WorldTransform becomes an empty matrix. Set this value to -1 number if you want to keep the last detected transformation indefinitely when the marker is not found.
member.remarks: Dropout count is used to make marker tracking more stable. For example, if MaxDropouts is set to 5, then even if the marker is not detected for 5 frames, it will use the previously detected transformation.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.MarkerFound
member.summary: Gets whether the marker is detected.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.InverseCameraView
member.summary: Gets or sets the inverse transform of the current camera's view matrix. Set this property if your camera's view matrix is other than an Identity matrix. Setting this properly will ensure that your geometry attached to this marker node will appear on top of the marker.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.WorldTransformation
member.summary: Gets the transformation of the detected marker.
member.remarks: If no marker is detected after MaxDropouts, then transformation matrix with all zero values is returned.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode.Optimize
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to optimize the scene graph by not traversing the nodes added below this node if marker is not found.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerBundleNode.#ctor(System.String,GoblinXNA.Device.Vision.Marker.IMarkerTracker,System.Collections.Generic.List{GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.MarkerNode},System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a marker bundle node.
member.param: Name of this marker bundle node
A marker tracker used to track this fiducial marker
A list of marker nodes that will supplement the base marker array
A list of configs that specify the fiducial marker (can be either an array or a single marker) to look for

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to auto reconfigure the transform of each supporting marker nodes relative to the base marker array. Default value is false.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.CaptureScene(System.String)

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RenderScene
member.summary: Only renders the 3D scene and the 2DUIs. Unlike the Draw function, this function doesn't perform physics update or scene graph updates. It simply renders the 3D scene. This method is useful when you need to render the scene more than once (e.g., when rendering multiple viewport or stereoscopic view).

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RenderScene(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Only renders the 3D scene (and the 2DUIs if 'renderUI' is true). Unlike the Draw function, this function doesn't perform physics update or scene graph updates. It simply renders the 3D scene. This method is useful when you need to render the scene more than once (e.g., when rendering multiple viewport or stereoscopic view). Whether to renderUI

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RenderScene(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Only renders the 3D scene (and the 2DUIs if 'renderUI' is true). Unlike the Draw function, this function doesn't perform physics update or scene graph updates if 'reTraverseScenegraph is false). It simply renders the 3D scene. This method is useful when you need to render the scene more than once (e.g., when rendering multiple viewport or stereoscopic view). Whether to renderUI Whether to re-traverse the scenegraph before rendering in the case the scene graph has changes

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.Update(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the scene graph.
member.remarks: For releases prior to version 4.0, you didn't need to call this Update method, but from version 4.0, you have to call this method in your Game.Update(...) method. This change enables the integration of Goblin XNA with WPF and Silverlight.
member.param: The elapsed game time (e.g., gameTime.ElasedGameTime)
Whether the game is running slow (e.g., gameTime.IsRunningSlowly)
Whether the game window is focused (e.g., this.IsActive)

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.Draw(System.TimeSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Renders the scene graph.
member.remarks: For releases prior to version 4.0, you didn't need to call this Draw method, but from version 4.0, you have to call this method in your Game.Draw(...) method. This change enables the integration of Goblin XNA with WPF and Silverlight.
member.param: The elapsed game time (e.g., gameTime.ElasedGameTime)
Whether the game is running slow (e.g., gameTime.IsRunningSlowly)

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the scene graph.
member.remarks: For releases prior to version 4.0, you didn't need to call this Dispose method, but from version 4.0, you have to call this method in your Game.Dispose(...) method. This change enables the integration of Goblin XNA with WPF and Silverlight.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RootNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the root node of this scene graph
member.exception: If assigned to null

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.CameraNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the camera node of this scene graph. (There can be multiple camera nodes in one scene graph, but only one camera node should be active at a time.)

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.Environment
member.summary: Gets or sets the environment effect simulated in this scene including fog, rain, and sunflare.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.BackgroundTexture
member.summary: Gets or sets the background texture. If ShowCameraImage is set, this texture will be ignored. Also, if this texture is set, the BackgroundColor will be ignored.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.BackgroundBound
member.summary: Gets or sets the background bound for video texture and 'BackgroundTexture' set by the user. If not set, it will use the full window dimension (which will cause stretching if the size of the texture and the window size is different)

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color. If either ShowCameraImage or BackgroundTexture is set, this will be ignored. Default color is Color.CornflowerBlue.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.BackgroundTextureEffects
member.summary: Gets or sets the sprite effects to apply to the BackgroundTexture.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.VideoBackgroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color mixed with the video image. This is applicable only when ShowCameraImage is set to true. Default color is Color.White.
member.remarks: You can use this property to, for example, modify the transparency of the video image or mix a color to it.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.SceneRenderTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets the render target in which the scene will be rendered. The default value is null, which is the back buffer.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.TransparencyDrawOrderComparer
member.summary: Gets or sets the comparer for sorting the drawing order of transparent geometries. If not set, then a default transparency comparer which compares the distance between center of the bounding volume of the geometry and the currently active camera location.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.MarkerTracker
member.summary: Gets or sets the marker tracking system.
member.remarks: If you already assigned the CameraNode, then its projection matrix will be modified to match the projection matrix of the marker tracker.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.VideoCaptures
member.summary: Gets a list of video capture instances.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.PhysicsEngine
member.summary: Gets or sets the specific physics engine implementation used for this scene graph.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RenderAxisAlignedBoundingBox
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to render the axis-aligned bounding box generated by the physics engine of your choice. Note that the IPhysics function GetAxisAlignedBoundingBox must be implemented correctly in order to render correctly.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RenderCollisionMesh
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to render the actual mesh used for collision detection by the physics engine of your choice. Note that the IPhysics function GetCollisionMesh must be implemented correctly in order to render correctly.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.NetworkHandler
member.summary: Gets or sets the network handler implementation used for this scene graph.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.UIRenderer
member.summary: Gets the UI renderer used in this scene. Use this property to add any UI components to be rendered in the scene.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.EnableShadowMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets whether shadow mapping should be enabled. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Make sure to set the ShadowMap property if you set this property to true.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.ShadowMap
member.summary: Gets or sets the shader for shadow mapping.
member.remarks: By setting this property, EnableShadowMapping property will be automatically set to true if the ShadowMap is not null.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.EnableLighting
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable the lighting in the scene. The default value is true.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.EnableFrustumCulling
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable culling on each geometry node based on whether the node is inside of the current camera frustum. The default value is true.
member.remarks: If your application is CPU bound, then setting this to false can improve the performance. However, if your application is GPU bound, then leaving this value to true would have better performance.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.AabbColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to draw the axis-aligned bounding box of each model for debugging. Default color is Color.YellowGreen.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.CollisionMeshColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used to draw the actual mesh used for collision detection of each model for debugging. Default color is Color.Purple.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.FPS
member.summary: Gets the current Frames Per Second count

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.TriangleCount
member.summary: Gets the current triangle count

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.ShowCameraImage
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show camera captured physical image in the background. By default, this is false.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.OverlayVideoID
member.summary: Gets or sets the video capture device ID used to provide the overlaid physical image. This ID should correspond to the videoDeviceID given to the initialized video device using InitVideoCapture method.
member.remarks: Getting or setting this property is exactly same as getting or setting the LeftEyeVideoID property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.TrackerVideoID
member.summary: Gets or sets the video capture device ID used to perform marker tracking (if available). This ID should correspond to the index in the VideoCaptures property, which is basically the order you have added the IVideoCapture through AddVideoCaptureDevice method.
member.remarks: Note that the notion of this ID has changed from Goblin XNA 3.x series.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.LeftEyeVideoID
member.summary: Gets or sets the video ID for left eye to use for stereo augmented reality. If you use single camera for stereo, then you should set both LeftEyeVideoID and RightEyeVideoID to the same ID. This ID should correspond to the index in the VideoCaptures property, which is basically the order you have added the IVideoCapture through AddVideoCaptureDevice method.
member.remarks: Note that the notion of this ID has changed from Goblin XNA 3.x series.
member.exception: If video ID is not valid or your camera node does not contain stereo information.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RightEyeVideoID
member.summary: Gets or sets the video ID for right eye to use for stereo augmented reality. If you use single camera for stereo, then you should set both LeftEyeVideoID and RightEyeVideoID to the same ID. This ID should correspond to the index in the VideoCaptures property, which is basically the order you have added the IVideoCapture through AddVideoCaptureDevice method.
member.remarks: Note that the notion of this ID has changed from Goblin XNA 3.x series.
member.exception: If video ID is not valid or your camera node does not contain stereo information.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.FreezeVideo
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to freeze currently active video streaming.
member.remarks: This will also affect the vision tracking if tracking is used.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RenderBeforeBackgroundCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback function that is invoked before rendering the background texture including the video texture.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RenderAfterBackgroundCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback function that is invoked after rendering the background texture including the video texture, but before rendering the 3D scene objects.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RenderBeforeUICallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback function that is invoked after all 3D geometries are rendered, but right before the 2D UIs are rendered.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RenderAfterUICallback
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback function that is invoked after the 2D UIs are rendered.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.NeedsImagePtr
member.summary: Gets or sets whether you need the image pointer to be passed back by your IVideoCapture.GetTextureImage(...) even if it is not needed by the Scene class. Default value is false. Use this with caution.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.NeedsImageData
member.summary: Gets or sets whether you need the image data (int array) to be passed back by your IVideoCapture.GetTextureImage(...) even if it is not needed by the Scene class. Default value is false. Use this with caution.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.GlobalUIShift
member.summary: Gets or sets the shift amount applied to all 2D HUD drawings including the text in the X screen coordinate.
member.remarks: This shift is applied only when right eye view is rendered in stereo mode.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.RenderLeftView
member.summary: Gets whether the scene graph is currently rendering the left eye view when in stereo mode.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.AlwaysSortTransparency
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to always sort transparent objects in the scene. It's best to set this to true if you have objects with Diffuse.W less than 1 in AR mode.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.Processing

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene.IsStarted
member.summary: Indicates whether the scene processing has already started.
member.remarks: This is used to check whether adding nodes outside of tree traversal is exception free.

member.summary: Gets or sets the currently traversed child index.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.SynchronizedGeometryNode
member.summary: A GeometryNode that is synchronized across multiple machines over network. NOTE: The original GeometryNode does not implement INetworkObject anymore, so if you want to synchronize the transform of a GeometryNode across machines, you should use this node instead.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.SynchronizedGeometryNode.RequiresPrecision
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the transform of this geometry node needs to be transmitted to the other machines with precise matrix values. If set to true, MatrixHelper.ConvertToUnoptimizedBytes (more bytes - 16 floats) will be used instead of MatrixHelper.ConvertToOptimizedBytes (less bytes - 7 or 10 floats) to convert its transform to bytes. Default value is false.

member.summary: Creates a scene graph node that defines the transform of its children with scaling of 1 in each dimension, no rotation, and no translation.
member.param: The name of this transform node

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a scene graph node that defines the transform of its children with scaling of 1 in each dimension, no rotation, no translation, and no empty name.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.Translation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the post-translation component that will be applied after rotation and scaling.
If WorldTransformation matrix is set directly after setting this property, then the value set for this property will not affect the transformation of this node.
member.remarks: If ReadOnly is set to true, then you can't set this property. Synonym of PostTranslation property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.PostTranslation
member.summary: Gets or sets the post-translation component that will be applied after rotation and scaling.
member.remarks: Synonym of Translation property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.PreTranslation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the pre-translation component that will be applied before rotation and scaling.
If WorldTransformation matrix is set directly after setting this property, then the value set for this property will not affect the transformation of this node.
member.remarks: If ReadOnly is set to true, then you can't set this property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.Rotation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the rotation component.
If WorldTransformation matrix is set directly after setting this property, then the value set for this property will not affect the transformation of this node.
member.remarks: If ReadOnly is set to true, then you can't set this property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.Scale
member.summary:
Gets or sets the scale component.
If WorldTransformation matrix is set directly after setting this property, then the value set for this property will not affect the transformation of this node.
member.remarks: If ReadOnly is set to true, then you can't set this property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.WorldTransformation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the transformation matrix. If you set this matrix directly, then whatever you set on Translation, Rotation, and Scale properties previoulsy will be ignored, and instead, this matrix value will be used to define the transformation of this node.
However, if you set any of the Translation, Rotation, and Scale properties after setting this matrix, then the composed matrix value from these three properties will be used.
member.remarks: If ReadOnly is set to true, then you can't set this property.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.UseUserDefinedTransform
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the user directly modified the transformation matrix instead using the composed one from Translation, Rotation, and Scale properties.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.UserDefinedTransformChanged
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the transformation matrix set directly by the user has been modified from the last one.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.ComposedTransform
member.summary: Gets the matrix composed from each individual transformation properties (Translation, Rotation, and Scale).

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.IsWorldTransformationDirty
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the transformation has been modified from the previous one.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.TransformNode.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this transform node is read only. If true, then you can not set any of the Translation, Rotation, Scale, and WorldTransformation properties.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.Shaders.SimpleEffectShader
member.summary: An implementation of a simple shader that uses the BasicEffect class.
member.remarks: Since BasicEffect class can only include upto three light sources, if more than three light sources are passed to this class, then the local light sources precede the global light sources. Both the global and local light nodes are added in the order of encounter in the preorder tree-traversal of the scene graph. For local lights, the last light node is the closest light node in the scene graph, so the light sources are added in the reverse order. If there are less than three local light sources, then global light sources are added in the normal order.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.Shaders.SimpleEffectShader.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a simple shader to render 3D meshes using the BasicEffect class.

member.summary: This shader does not support special camera effect.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.State
member.summary: The main class of the Goblin XNA framework.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.State.InitGoblin(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.IGraphicsDeviceService,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.ContentManager,System.String)
member.summary: This is the very first method that needs to be called before using any of the Goblin XNA framework.
member.param: GraphicsDeviceManager object from the main Game class
ContentManager object from the main Game class

The full path of the setting file in XML format. Setting file is used, for example, to specify where the model files are stored if not directly under "Content" directory. You can also add your own setting variable with certain value, and retrieve the value using GetSettingVariable method.
Can be an empty string, in which case, a template setting file (template_setting.xml) that contains all of the setting variables used in Goblin XNA will be generated. If you don't specify the setting file, then all of the resource files (e.g., models, textures, spritefonts, etc) should be directly stored under the "Content" directory, so Goblin XNA can figure out where to load those resources.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.State.GetSettingVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the setting variables loaded at the initialization time.
member.param: The name of the setting variable

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.State.LoadSettings(System.String)
member.summary: Loads all of the added setting variables.
member.param: the filename where the setting variables are stored

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.State.WriteSettingTemplate
member.summary: Writes out a template setting file that contains all of the setting variables used in Goblin XNA.

member.summary: Gets or sets the threading options by oring the ThreadOptions enum. This property is used to control what operations to be threaded. If your CPU is single-core, then there is no point to thread any operations.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.State.BoundingBoxColor

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.State.IsServer
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this machine acts as a server when networking is enabled

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.State.NumberOfClientsToWait
member.summary: Number of clients to wait for connections before starting physics simulation. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.State.LogPrintLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the log levels that will be printed out. Default value is LogLevel.Error.
member.example: LogLevel.Log means prints out all log levels including Warning and Error messages. LogLevel.Warning means prints out only Warning and Error messages. LogLevel.Error means prints out only Error messages.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.State.ShowFPS

member.summary: Gets or sets whether to display the triangle count of all of the rendered models in the scene.
member.remarks: The color of the text can be changed by modifying DebutTextColor property.

member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the FPS or triangle count text. The default color is Color.White.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier
member.summary: A helper class for displaying graphical debugging/notification messages on the HUD.
member.remarks: By default, all of the appended messages are displayed on the HUD forever. If you want to make them disappear after a specified period of time, set FadeOutTime to force the messages to fade out after the specified time.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.#cctor
member.summary: A static constructor to initialize all of the necessary member fields.
member.remarks: You don't need to call this constructor. This constructor is called automatically when you access any of its properties or functions.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.AddMessage(System.String)
member.summary: Appends a new debugging/notification message.
member.param: A debugging/notification message to be appended

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.GetMessages
member.summary: Gets all of the newly appended messages from the last time calling this method. All of the newly appended messages are cleared when this method is called.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.Placement
member.summary: Gets or sets the display location of the debugging/notification messages.
member.remarks: The default value is NotifierPlacement.TopRight. If defined as Custom, then you need to set the CustomStartLocation and CustomAppearDirection properties.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.CustomStartLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom starting location of the notifier messages to appear when Placement property is set to Custom.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.CustomAppearDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction in which the text appears when Placement property is set to Custom.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.FadeOutTime
member.summary: Gets or sets how long each message will be displayed on the HUD before they start to fade out specified in milliseconds. The newly set values affects only the newly added messages.
member.remarks: The default value is -1, which means the messages never fade out.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the sprite font to use to display the messages.
member.remarks: The default sprint font is same as the one used for FPS and triangle count.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the debugging/notification messages.
member.remarks: The default color is Color.Red

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.MessageCount
member.summary: Gets the number of currently displayed messages.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.Notifier.NotifierPlacement
member.summary: An enum for display location of the debugging/notification messages.

member.summary: A helper class to hold the notifier info and states

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.ButtonGroup
member.summary:
This class is used to create a multiple-exclusion scope for a set of buttons. Creating a set of buttons with the same ButtonGroup object means that turning "on" one of those buttons turns "off" all other buttons in the group. Typically, a button group contains G2DRadioButton.
Initially, all buttons in the group are unselected. Once any button is selected, one button is always selected in the group.

A display area for a text string. A label does not react to input events such as keyboard or mouse events. You can specify the location of the label with respect to the display area by setting the horizontal and vertical alignment.
In order to display the text, G2DLabel.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the text will not show up.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider
member.summary:
A slider lets the user graphically select a value by sliding a knob within a bounded interval. The slider can show both major tick marks and minor tick marks between them, as well as labels.
In order to display the value labels, G2DSlider.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the labels will not show up.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.valueIsAdjusting
member.summary: Indicator of whether the current changes to the value property are part of a series of changes

member.summary: Creates a slider with specified orientation, and minimum, maximum, and initial values.
member.param: The orientation of the slider
The minimum value the slider can take
The maximum value the slider can take
An initial value between the range of min and max values

member.summary: Creates a horizontal slider with the specified minimum, maximum, and initial values.

member.summary: Gets the range of values "covered" by the knob

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.MajorTickSpacing
member.summary:
Gets or sets the slider's major tick spacing.
For example, for a max value of 10 and min value of 0, major tick spacing of 5 will draw major ticks at 0, 5, and 10.
member.exception: If MinorTickSpacing is set and this value is smaller than MinorTickSpacing

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.MinorTickSpacing
member.summary:
Gets or sets the slider's minor tick spacing.
For example, for a max value of 10 and min value of 0, minor tick spacing of 2 will draw minor ticks at 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 10. NOTE: If there is an overlap between major ticks and minor ticks, only major ticks will be shown

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.SnapToTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to make the knob resolve to the closest tick mark next to where the user positioned the knob

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.PaintTicks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to paint the ticks including both major and minor ticks.
member.remarks: Major tick spacing has to be defined before the ticks can be painted

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.PaintLabels
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to paint the labels.
member.remarks: Labels are only shown below major ticks. Also, major tick spacing has to be defined before the labels can be painted

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.PaintTrack
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to paint the track behind the knob

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSlider.ValueIsAdjusting
member.summary: Gets whether the current changes to the value property are part of a series of changes

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.Fancy.G2DSuggestField
member.summary: A suggestion field is a text field that provides a list of possible text inputs such as search terms in a drop down box every time the user modifies a text in the field. If the user selects one of the texts in the suggestion list, the text in the text field will be replaced with the selected one. The suggestion list disappears either if a selection is made or the user presses 'Enter' key.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DTextField
member.summary:
A text field displays a text string based on the user's keyboard input. This component needs to be focused in order to receive the keyboard input.
In order to display the text and the caret, G2DTextField.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the text and caret will not show up.

member.summary: Gets or sets a matching function used to identify which texts from the list of possible text inputs should be displayed based on the current text typed in the text field. This matching function is used only if Criteria property is set to MatchCriteria.Custom.

member.name: P:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.Fancy.G2DSuggestField.KeepSuggestionBoxOpaque
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to keep the suggestion box to render in opaque background. If set to false, then the suggestion box will have the same transparency value as this component. If true, the suggestion box will remain opaque even if this component's transparency value is modified. The default value is true.
member.remarks: If there are other UI components positioned below this component, then it's better to set this property to true.

member.summary:
A G2D component that displays an integer value within a bounded interval. This component is typically used to express the progress of some task by displaying the percentage completed and optionally, a textual display of the percentage.
In order to display the percentage completed text, G2DProgressBar.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the text will not show up.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DRadioButton
member.summary:
An implementation of a radio button, which is a button that can be selected or deselected.
If you want to have at most one radio button selected at any time within a group of radio buttons, create a ButtonGroup instance, and add those radio buttons to the ButtonGroup instance. For multiple groups, you should use multiple ButtonGroup instances.
In order to display the text next to the radio button, G2DButton.TextFont must be set. Otherwise, the text will not show up. Note that the size of the radio button icon depends on the font size. The larger the font size, the larger the radio button icon.

member.summary: Center position of the radio button

member.summary: Color used to draw the inside of the radio button

member.summary: Color used to highlight the inner border of the radio button when selected

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DRadioButton.color
member.summary: Color used to draw the border of the radio button

member.summary: Creates an initially unselected radio button with the specified label.

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSpinner
member.summary: A single line input field that lets the user select a number or an object from an ordered sequence. It provides a pair of tiny arrow buttons for stepping through the elements of the sequence. The keyboard up/down arrow keys also cycle through the elements. The value in the spinner is not directly editable.

member.name: F:GoblinXNA.UI.UI2D.G2DSpinner.initialPressInterval
member.summary: When the mouse is held down on either the up or down arrow, it should increment or decrement the value. But before taking the action, wait for some press intervals for avoiding unintended multiple increments or decrements

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.UI3D.UI3DRenderer.Write3DText(System.String,Nuclex.Fonts.VectorFont,GoblinXNA.UI.UI3D.UI3DRenderer.Text3DStyle,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix)
member.summary: Draws a 3D text with the given font, style, color, and transformation.
member.remarks: This 3D text won't be actually drawn until Flush() method is called. If this method is called before base.Draw(...) in your main Game class's Draw(...) function, then it's automatically flushed when base.Draw(...) is called. If this method is called after base.Draw(...) function, then you need to call Flush() function after calling one or more of this function. Otherwise, the 3D texts drawing will be deferred until the next base.Draw(...) or Flush() call.
member.param: Text string to be displayed in 3D.
Font to use for the 3D text.
3D text style (Outline, Fill, or Extrude).
Color of the 3D text.
Transformation of the left-bottom corner of the 3D text.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.UI3D.UI3DRenderer.Write3DText(System.String,Nuclex.Fonts.VectorFont,GoblinXNA.UI.UI3D.UI3DRenderer.Text3DStyle,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Color,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Matrix,GoblinXNA.GoblinEnums.HorizontalAlignment,GoblinXNA.GoblinEnums.VerticalAlignment)
member.summary: Draws a 3D text with the given font, style, color, transformation, horizontal align, and vertical align.
member.remarks: This 3D text won't be actually drawn until Flush() method is called. If this method is called before base.Draw(...) in your main Game class's Draw(...) function, then it's automatically flushed when base.Draw(...) is called. If this method is called after base.Draw(...) function, then you need to call Flush() function after calling one or more of this function. Otherwise, the 3D texts drawing will be deferred until the next base.Draw(...) or Flush() call.
member.param: Text string to be displayed in 3D.
Font to use for the 3D text.
3D text style (Outline, Fill, or Extrude).
Color of the 3D text.
Transformation of the 3D text.
The horizontal (x-axis) shifting

member.name: T:GoblinXNA.UI.UIRenderer
member.summary:
The renderer for all 2D and 3D UI components, including FPS, triangle count, and debugging/notification messages.
An UI component needs to be added to this renderer through Scene.UIRender before it can be rendered in 3D scene.

member.name: M:GoblinXNA.UI.UIRenderer.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a renderer class for taking care of the UI rendering.
member.remarks: Do not instantiate this class since this class is already instantiated in the GoblinXNA.SceneGraph.Scene class.
